lib.runTest

Class BatchTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • lib.runTest.BatchTest

  • public class BatchTest
extends java.lang.Object
    this class provide facility to run the executable command with specified inputs. this class use multiple objects of RunTest class to perform such a task.
    Author:
    Neel Patel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BatchTest(java.lang.String cmd, IntInput... ar)
      creates object with executable command and multiple inputs.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BatchTest

        public BatchTest(java.lang.String cmd,
                 IntInput... ar)
        creates object with executable command and multiple inputs.
        Parameters:
        cmd - command to be executed.
        ar - Object of type IntInput to give inputs to the processes.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public java.util.stream.Stream<IntIODetail> execute()
        execute the command for all provided inputs in sequence. it creates a new thread known as executer thread which will execute the command for different inputs one by one. it returns immediately, without waiting for tasks to done. if the executer thread is already initiated it return with null immediately. it returns stream of IntIODetail which gives Input and corresponding output. the stream returned by this method is infinite stream, it will encounter null when there is no elements exist to process.
        Returns:
        stream of IntIODetail, each element contain result of execution.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        this method change the flag to false to terminate the execution process. although the currently running process will be executed as it is. next tasks will not be initiated.

      • getOutputs

        public java.util.List<IntIODetail> getOutputs()
        this method returns the result as list of objects of IntIODetail. this method will call execute method if it is not called before. if the executer thread is not terminated yet then it will wait for it to join.
        Returns:
        result as List of IntIODetail

      • getInputs

        public IntInput[] getInputs()
        this method return array of IntInput. changes made in the array returned by this method will not reflected. i.e. this object will not affected.
        Returns:
        returns the array of the IntInput

      • finalize

        public void finalize()
              throws java.lang.Throwable
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable
